Culturing of mouse mammary tumor organoids:
The medium is changed twice per week and organoids are passaged 1:4-1:6 once per week.

For long-term storage, organoid cultures were mixed with Recovery Cell Culture Freezing Medium \(Gibco) and frozen following the standard procedures.
When required, the organoids were thawed using standard thawing procedures, embedded in BME and cultured as described above.
Transduction of mouse mammary tumor organoids:

Aspirate media and disrupt organoids using TrypLE as described above
  2.
Aliquot cell suspension into tubes and

Pellet in viral suspension \(diluted in ENR) supplemented with 8 μg/ml Polybrene \(Millipore)
  4.

Centrifuge at 600 g for 60 min at room temperature
  5.
Transfer cell suspensions into tubes and
Add media supplemented with the appropriate antibiotic\(s) for selection of transduced cells
Transplantation of mouse mammary tumor organoids:

For transplantation, use organoids at a size corresponding to an average of 150-200 cells per organoid
  2.

Spin at 900 rpm for 5 min and re

Suspend appropriately in BME/ENR media mix: for KB1P\(M) organoids – 10<sup>4</sup>/40 ul, for KB2P organoids – 5x10<sup>4</sup>/40 ul 
  6.
